sub_topic: Determining the type of bond between two atoms
message_1: What is the type of bond formed between a chlorine atom (Cl) and a fluorine atom (F)?
message_2: The type of bond formed between a chlorine atom (Cl) and a fluorine atom (F) is a covalent bond. This is because both chlorine and fluorine are non-metal elements, and they share electrons to achieve a stable electron configuration.
